intro: Chaetogastra aurea, commonly known as the golden chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive textured appearance. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
